Title: I won’t negotiate with bandits, says Bago
Summary: The Niger State Governor, Muhammad Umaru Bago, has vowed not to negotiate with bandits . Bago says he will instead seek the intervention of the President and the National Security Adviser .

Title: Rivers LG administrator’s wife urges nursing mothers to engage in home gardening
Summary: Rivers LG administrator’s wife urges nursing mothers to engage in home gardening . Prof. Amiye Francis has advocated for home gardens as a means to ensure a steady food supply for nursing mothers .

Title: ODE TO THE HEROINE OF THE PRESS
Summary: Dr. Doyin Abiola, who joined the Saints yesterday, showed up on both counts . She was the scion of the illustrious Aboaba family, reputed for its reputation .

Title: 2025 World Breastfeeding Week: UNICEF decries poor workplace support for breastfeeding mothers
Summary: UNICEF decries lack of infrastructure and policy for breastfeeding mothers in workplaces . Chief of Field in Enugu, Mrs. Juliet Chiluwe, stated this in an opening remark during a virtual discussion .

Title: Why Nigeria’s financial inclusion agenda will rise or fall on strength of its digital infrastructure
Summary: The drive for financial inclusion in Nigeria is often measured in the number of banking agents deployed or mobile apps launched . Yet, beneath the surface lies a more decisive factor: infrastructure . As payment service banks (PSBs) step into the spotlight, PSBs are stepping in to the spotlight .

Title: Israeli security cabinet to hold talks over future Gaza war plans
Summary: Israel's security cabinet expected to meet later Thursday to discuss military plans in Gaza . Families of hostages have launched a desperate plea for help aboard a flotilla to the territory .

Title: GMO foods are not bad for us – NAFDAC DG
Summary: The Director General of the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC), Prof. Mojisola Adeyeye, has said that genetically modified foods (GMOs) are not inherently harmful to human health, provided that they meet established safety standards .

Title: Air strikes kill over 30 terrorists gathered for wedding in Zamfara
Summary: Air strikes kill over 30 terrorists gathered for wedding in Zamfara . Captain David Adewusi said the strikes were conducted based on credible intelligence .

Title: Flood aftermath: Lagos govt mulls humanitarian intervention in affected communities
Summary: Lagos govt mulls humanitarian intervention in affected communities . Lagos State Government considering humanitarian support for affected residents . The state government is considering humanitarian intervention to help those affected by the flooding .

Title: Nigerian newspapers review: [2027] Options before the North
Summary: One headline features a close ally of ex-President Jonathan confirming that the former leader was ready to run for the 2027 presidency . Ex-presidential candidate Jonathan is said to be ready for the presidency .

Title: GMOs are not bad for us, NAFDAC DG debunks health concerns
Summary: Prof Mojisola Adeyeye has stated that genetically modified organisms known as GMOs, particularly in food, are not harmful to human health, provided that safety protocols are followed . The Director-General of the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control said the type of food and safety considerations taken are critical factors in determining their safety .

Title: Flooding: NEMA, AnSEMA others intensify preparations, urge residents to relocate
Summary: The National Emergency Management Agency and its counterparts in Anambra, Ebonyi and Enugu states said they have set up machinery to respond to the impending floods in the zone . The Nigeria Meteorological Agency and the Nigeria Hydrological Services Agency have issued fresh warnings about possible flooding in about 19 states in the country and called for prepared

Title: Oyo adopts new compensation rates for landowners
Summary: The Oyo State Government received the revised compensation rates on crops and economic trees for landowners affected by projects to ensure fairness and justice . The state Commissioner for Lands, Housing, and Urban Development, Williams Akin-Funmilayo, said the initiative would significantly enhance the state’s capacity for effective land administration .

Title: Police arrest three over 'coup plot' linked to German prince
Summary: Prosecutors say plot uncovered in 2022 aimed at attacking German parliament, usurping power and installing Prince Heinrich XIII Reuss as head of state . Plot allegedly an offshoot of Citizens of the Reich, movement of extremists and gun enthusiasts who reject the legitimacy of the modern German republic . 27 alleged ringleaders, including Reuss, are currently on

Title: Tanker with 50,000 litres of diesel skids off road in Oyo
Summary: A tanker carrying 50,000 litres of Automotive Gas Oil skidded off the road on Wednesday evening at Jin-Jofes Filling Station, Iwo Road in Ibadan, the Oyo State capital . Eyewitnesses said the incident occurred as a result of brake failure while the driver was attempting to navigate a bend
